https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The process of making observations in the field, as well as collecting and studying samples of Earth's materials to understand the geology of an area, and more specifically to produce a diagram, drawing, or other graphical representation of the area in question, by means of signs and/or symbols and with the means of orientation indicated, so that the relative position and size of each feature on the map corresponds to its correct geographical situation according to a definite and established scale and projection.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia
